docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is the events that happened on Friday, January 9th, 2026 in ACIT 2811 - UX/UI. The instructions of in the class was to find three examples of websites with bad user interfaces. We were to pick one out of the three to redesign.

docs.title: Websites
docs.text:
The following were our top three websites

  1. Discount beds
  2. Yale school of Art
  3. X-ray

docs.title: Chosen Website
docs.text: The website we chose was discount beds. image fo discount beds

docs.title: Reasons
docs.text:
We chose the discount beds website for the following reasons.

  1. Needs a good Structure

  2. International freelancing opportunities

docs.title: Redesign Details
docs.text:
• Navigations bar
  • Multiple webpages
  • Contact page
  • Payment page

  • Login page

  • Pictures for available beds in stock.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is the report of the event that took place in ACIT 2811 - UX/UI on January 16th, 2026. The class was a simple introduction to marketing researching. We had two in class activities and a take home proposal assignment.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
Three main topics were discussed in class,

  1. Design Thinking
  2. User-Centered Design
  3. Usability Factors

docs.title: Definition of Topics
docs.text:
• Design Thinking is a problem solving process that can be applied to problems.

  • User-Centered Design is an iterative set of steps to solve problems related to a product or service for users.

docs.title: Design Thinking process
docs.text:
1. Empthize
  2. Define
  3. Ideate - brainstorm
  4. Prototype
  5. Test

docs.title: User-Centered Design process
docs.text:
1. Understand the context
  2. Specify requirements
  3. Design solutions
  4. Evaluate solutions

docs.title: In-class activities
docs.text:
These are the in class activities we did in class. The first one involved design thinking. We were given a case study and asked to write a Design thinking process for it. This was done individually.

For the second activity each group in class was given a criteria (Ours: Accessible and not Valuable; and vice versa) and asked to find two products that met the criteria. The second activity was done in a group. Our group consisted of three individual:

  • Ryan Bo
  • Long

  • Calvin

  • Design Thinking in class activity

  • 7 Factors Group Activity

docs.title: Assignment
docs.text:
• Project Proposal
  • Market Research Document

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is a report that took place in ACIT 2811 - UX/UI on _January 24th, 2026. The class involved a lot of activites. These activities were conducted after Chris explain each topic.

docs.title: Topics
docs.text:
The topics the class focused on were:

  • Personas
  • User Scenarios
  • User Stories

docs.title: Definition of terms
docs.text:
• Persona: is a description of a possible user of a product or service. Personas are created to build empathy, identify user characteristics, behaviours, and goals.

  • User Stories: identify technical features of a product or service we need to build. They are a series of steps that identify things we need to build and make sure that they are implemented on the final project.

  • User Scenarios: are technical descriptions of steps required to complete a User Story.

docs.title: Activiites
docs.text:
These are the in class activities that were conducted.

  • Persona
  • User Scenarios
  • User Stories

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This is a report of the events that took place in ACIT 2811 - UX/UI, on January 30th, 2026. The class was about Ideation. We did a few in-class activities and started with week 05 topic (Information Architecture).

docs.title: Topic(s)
docs.text:
• Problem Statements
  • Ideation
